classification.reason: Peak 75% ‚Äî needs bigger run for ideal setup

tweets.hook: $ANVS up +65% after a +75% peak ‚Äî but an ATM filing 14 days ago makes this move fragile. This is how dilution traps form. üßµ
breakdown: ATM = At-The-Market stock issuance. Company can sell new shares anytime ‚Üí more supply ‚Üí weaker price. If you're holding an ice-cream cone and more cones appear, yours melts faster. üç¶

Why this caught my eye:
‚Ä¢ Market cap: $97M (tiny, very vulnerable)
‚Ä¢ ATM filing: 14 days ago
‚Ä¢ Price spiked +75% (now at +65%)
High price + low cash = perfect conditions to raise money

Additional context:
‚Ä¢ Volume pattern: fading, indicating distribution
‚Ä¢ Small float: dilution impacts more
‚Ä¢ Trend: pulled back -10% from peak
This is how step-one cracks look before big flushes.

Bear thesis builds if:
‚Ä¢ First heavy red candle with elevated sell volume
‚Ä¢ Price fails to reclaim highs
‚Ä¢ ATM usage confirmed
Bull scenario if price runs again on strong volume ‚Äî ATM may not trigger yet

This isn't advice ‚Äî just pattern recognition.
Big spike + small cap + fresh ATM = risk
Track price action like a hawk. ü¶Ö

rationale: A small company like Annovis Bio, Inc. with a recent ATM filing and significant price spike could see stock value decline if new shares are sold into the market.
